column5: Well here is the result of today adventure with my son and dad.    300+ fow, 30' -40' down, dark colors spoons, 2.8-3.0 mph I think when is was all done we were like 15 for 22 for about 3-4 hours of fishing. 5 Kings the rest Bowsâ€¦.from 5 to 18 Lbs. The ones on the picture were the selected few for the neighborhood BBQ party tonight. Keep hearing on the radio most guys complaining of not getting any or getting one or two....not the case for us today... Now that we did have good action today, it's time to start packing for the anual trip up North... Wayneeeeeeeeeee.......tell those Temagami and Algonquin lakers to get ready for us...we'll pay them a visit later this week  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Well done Emil, lots of 'bows out there eh? We didn't see a single salmon! -Brian
WOW, fire up the barbie, WTG...
Excellent report and good job icefisherman  Thanks for sharing Leechman
Sounds like an amazing day out on the water. Fishing Lake O can be tough but its days like that that keep everyone coming back for more. Thanks for sharing.
Great looking fish, looks like i missed out!
Nice catch, but eating an 18 lb fish from Lake Ontario? Too many of those will send you to the
We wondered if you were out there today as well Emil.  Looks like you were out deeper than us.  Nice haul.  Enjoy your BBQ bud.  Joey
nice fish!! looks like you had a great day out there. I found it tough yesterday. Lots of knock offs and chasers. we worked hard for 5.
